docs.lead_paragraph: Liberia's President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf apologised on Saturday for the high death toll among the country's healthcare workers who have fought an Ebola outbreak, which has killed nearly 1,000 people in three countries.

headline.main: Liberia President Apologises for High Toll for Ebola Health Workers
headline.print_headline: Liberia President Apologises for High Toll for Ebola Health Workers

docs.snippet: Liberia's President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf apologised on Saturday for the high death toll among the country's healthcare workers who have fought an Ebola outbreak, which has killed nearly 1,000 people in three countries.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials said Friday that they would use a retooled state health exchange website for this fall’s open enrollment period.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Health Site Will Stay State-Based
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Health Site Will Stay State-Based

docs.abstract: Massachusetts officials say they will use a retooled state health exchange website for fall 2014 open enrollment period; Massachusetts Health Connector was established by the state’s 2006 health overhaul law, but it sputtered when it was updated to comply with the Affordable Care Act, sending 250,000 people to temporary coverage.
docs.snippet: Officials said Friday that they would use a retooled state health exchange website for this fall’s open enrollment period.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Critics of the decision to grant more autonomy to the Big 5 conferences said that the new structure would increase the wealth disparity among university athletic programs and that it failed to address needed reforms.

headline.main: N.C.A.A.’s Vote on Autonomy Generates Criticism
headline.print_headline: Vote on Autonomy Generates Criticism From Small Conferences

docs.abstract: Critics of NCAA's decision to grant more autonomy to five wealthiest athletic conferences contend that new structure will increase financial disparity among university athletic programs.
docs.snippet: Critics of the decision to grant more autonomy to the Big 5 conferences said that the new structure would increase the wealth disparity among university athletic programs and that it failed to address needed reforms.

docs.lead_paragraph: Oracle Corp. has sued the state of Oregon in a fight over the state's health insurance exchange, saying government officials are using the technology company's software despite $23 million in disputed bills.

headline.main: Oracle Sues Oregon Over Health Insurance Exchange
headline.print_headline: Oracle Sues Oregon Over Health Insurance Exchange

docs.snippet: Oracle Corp. has sued the state of Oregon in a fight over the state's health insurance exchange, saying government officials are using the technology company's software despite $23 million in disputed bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bulgaria's central bank has asked the International Monetary Fund to carry out an in-depth review of the Balkan country's financial sector following its worst banking crisis since the 1990s, it said on Friday.

headline.main: Bulgaria Asks IMF for Financial System Review After Bank Woes
headline.print_headline: Bulgaria Asks IMF for Financial System Review After Bank Woes

docs.snippet: Bulgaria's central bank has asked the International Monetary Fund to carry out an in-depth review of the Balkan country's financial sector following its worst banking crisis since the 1990s, it said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than seven million Americans have gained health coverage through government programs including Medicaid since enrollment in Obamacare health insurance was launched October 1, the U.S. administration said on Friday.

headline.main: New Medicaid Enrollments Top 7 Million Under Obamacare
headline.print_headline: New Medicaid Enrollments Top 7 Million Under Obamacare

docs.snippet: More than seven million Americans have gained health coverage through government programs including Medicaid since enrollment in Obamacare health insurance was launched October 1, the U.S. administration said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Well-known details about U.S. Rep. Scott DesJarlais — including that he once urged a mistress to seek an abortion and held a gun in his mouth for hours outside his ex-wife's room — didn't deter Republican primary voters from giving him a possible shot at a third term.

headline.main: Past Doesn't Haunt DesJarlais in Rural Tenn.
headline.print_headline: Past Doesn't Haunt DesJarlais in Rural Tenn.

docs.lead_paragraph: Small boats made of reeds have been used for hundreds of years in a Peruvian village, but the reed beds are dwindling and so is interest in the fishing life the boats make possible.

headline.main: Town’s Floating Symbol Fading Into the Sunset
headline.print_headline: Town’s Floating Symbol Fading Into the Sunset

docs.abstract: Huanchaco Journal; small boats made of reeds have been used for hundreds of years in small Peruvian village Huanchaco, but the reed beds and shorelines are dwindling and so is interest in the fishing life the boats make possible; there are only about 30 fishermen still working regularly.
docs.snippet: Small boats made of reeds have been used for hundreds of years in a Peruvian village, but the reed beds are dwindling and so is interest in the fishing life the boats make possible.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and ANDREA ZARATE

docs.lead_paragraph: Granting autonomy to the five richest conferences would contradict the stated mission of the N.C.A.A., which is to govern college sports in a fair manner.

headline.main: N.C.A.A.’s Vote on New Rules Creating Divisions Among Conferences

docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column asserts that there is nothing fair, equitable, and arguably even sportsmanlike about NCAA voting to give richest five conferences autonomy to enrich scholarships, provide better health insurance and loosen strict relationship between agents and players in ways that few other nearly 300 Division I sports programs could match.
docs.snippet: Granting autonomy to the five richest conferences would contradict the stated mission of the N.C.A.A., which is to govern college sports in a fair manner.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new autonomy measure for the richest conferences is an acknowledgment that the amateur ideal is at this point just that: an ideal.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends National Collegiate Athletic Assn vote to allow five richest conferences greater autonomy is acknowledgment that college sports must change; contends decision will benefit larger, richer institutions greatly, and that smaller schools will find it hard to recruit top talent; holds decision shows that amateur ideal is no longer viable due to commercialization of college sports.
docs.snippet: A new autonomy measure for the richest conferences is an acknowledgment that the amateur ideal is at this point just that: an ideal.
